text: if you circulate the music and then it
will sell
[Music]
when I look back at the history of my
label I started this label when I was 19
and I was putting on shows literally in
my living room it grew from that living
room into small little bars in Hollywood
into clubs and I remember Napster
the song swapping company is now in the
top 50 list of most visited sites on the
web and even at that era this is like 10
10 plus years ago physical was going
down and we were physical records
business and this is like our source of
income it was a big deal and like
they're like oh no people are giving
away music pirating music the latest
move in the legal chess game between the
Recording Industry and Napster is in the
Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals if they
think Napster's bad I can tell I can
tell you there's a lot worse coming this
amazing little device holds a thousand
songs because right in my pocket iTunes
went up this week Apple Computer
launched its iTunes Music Store and so
we made in the station as like one I
felt like we're one of the first
independent labels to decide to give
away our first single of our biggest app
master craft at the time
it was a decision that was made against
every one of my team but we kind of got
to go with the flow with like where
things are going we got to like think
ahead you know six months later we
wanted to see the analysis of how the
song did we realized the song that we
gave away sold the most amount of
records for the entire album you
circulate the music and then it will
sell you know I hope that by the end of
their Spotify can launch in the u.s. I
think it's going to be a very disruptive
event and so going into this new age of
streaming I don't really necessarily
look at the downloads as much they look
at the streaming numbers streaming
numbers is by far more important for
example just hold on we're at like 230
million streams we might be on the
Downloads in America like a hundred
thousand or something that's incredible
so it just goes to show how much more
power adds and whenever I see my songs
or Dimock songs on playlists it's a
major jump for the artists on all
verticals or their business
[Applause]
[Music]
